0.question: 1. What is the purpose of the Leave Policy?
0.answer: At BlueOrbit Technologies Pvt. Ltd., we value employee well-being and work–life balance. This policy defines the rules, eligibility, types, and procedures related to employee leave, ensuring transparency while meeting business requirements.

1.question: 2. Who is eligible for leave?
1.answer:
• All regular and confirmed employees are eligible for leave as per this policy.
• Trainees and probationary employees are eligible only for Sick Leave.
• Leave entitlements are calculated on a calendar-year basis (1 January – 31 December).

2.question: 11. What is Leave Without Pay (LWP)?
2.answer:
• Applicable when leave balance is zero or negative
• Requires approval from the Reporting Manager and Head of HR
• Any LWP exceeding 10 consecutive days requires CEO or Director approval
• Holidays falling during LWP are not paid

3.question: 12. What is Sabbatical Leave?
3.answer:
• Available to employees with a minimum of 5 years of continuous service
• Maximum duration is up to 1 year
• Purpose includes higher education or job-related skill development
• Approval flow: Reporting Manager → HOD → Head of HR → CEO

4.question: 13. What are the maternity leave benefits?
4.answer:
• Provided as per the Maternity Benefit Act, 1961
• Duration of 26 weeks with pay
• Applicable to women employees not covered under ESI
• Pregnancy-related illness leave may be extended up to 1 additional month and adjusted against leave balance

5.question: 14. What is the paternity leave policy?
5.answer:
• 10 working days of paid leave
• Applicable for up to 2 children
• Must be availed within 6 months of childbirth or adoption

6.question: 15. Can employees take leave during probation or notice period?
6.answer:
• Leave during probation or notice period is generally not permitted
• Exceptions may be granted only in genuine emergencies with HR approval

7.question: 16. What is the leave accumulation and encashment policy?
7.answer:
• Maximum leave accumulation allowed is 45 days (Privilege Leave only)
• Automatic encashment occurs at the start of the next calendar year
• If accumulated leave exceeds 30 days, only the excess from the previous year is encashed

8.question: 17. How do employees apply for leave?
8.answer:
• Leave must be applied through the HRMS or official leave application system
• Applications should be submitted within 30 days, except in emergencies
• Leave requests must include the type of leave, start and end dates, and reason

9.question: 18. How is leave approved?
9.answer:
• The Reporting Manager reviews and approves or rejects the request
• The employee is notified once a decision is made
• HR records the approved leave

10.question: 19. What happens if the leave policy is violated?
10.answer:
• Minor violations may result in verbal or written warnings
• Serious violations may lead to suspension, demotion, or disciplinary action
• Actions are taken by the Reporting Manager in coordination with HR

11.question: 20. Can management make exceptions to this policy?
11.answer: Yes. Management reserves the right to modify or grant exceptions to this policy to meet statutory or business requirements, subject to approval from the Head of HR.

12.question: 3. What is the scope of this policy?
12.answer: This policy applies to all employees of the organization, regardless of role or department.

13.question: 4. What types of leave are available?
13.answer: Employees are entitled to the following types of leave:

14.question: 5. How is Privilege Leave (PL) calculated?
14.answer:
• 18 days per year
• Credited at 1.5 days per month
• Available only after confirmation or completion of probation
• Can be accumulated or encashed as per company policy

15.question: 6. How does Casual Leave (CL) work?
15.answer:
• 12 days per year
• Credited at the start of the calendar year or on the date of joining
• Can be taken for a minimum of 0.5 day and a maximum of 3 consecutive days
• Cannot be carried forward or encashed

16.question: 7. What are the Sick Leave (SL) rules?
16.answer:
• 12 days per year
• Minimum leave: 0.5 day
• Maximum leave: 5 consecutive days
• A doctor’s certificate is mandatory if sick leave exceeds 3 consecutive days
• The company may request a medical review if required

17.question: 8. Are leaves prorated for new joiners?
17.answer: Yes. Employees joining mid-year will receive leave entitlements on a prorated basis, calculated based on the remaining months in the calendar year.

18.question: 9. How much advance notice is required for leave?
18.answer:
• Planned leave must be applied at least 3 working days in advance
• Emergency leave must be informed as soon as possible

19.question: 10. How many festival and holiday leaves are provided?
19.answer:
• 10 paid holidays per year, including national and regional festivals
• The holiday list is shared at the start of the calendar year
• These holidays cannot be carried forward or encashed

20.question: 1. What is the purpose of the Reimbursement Policy?
20.answer: The Reimbursement Policy of BlueOrbit Technologies Pvt. Ltd. defines the rules, eligibility, limits, and procedures for reimbursing employees for official business-related expenses incurred while performing their job duties.

21.question: 2. Who is eligible for reimbursement?
21.answer:
• All regular and confirmed employees are eligible for reimbursement.
• Trainees and probationary employees may claim reimbursements only with prior approval from their Reporting Manager and HR.
• Reimbursements are applicable only for expenses incurred for official business purposes.

22.question: 3. What is the scope of this policy?
22.answer: This policy applies to all eligible employees incurring expenses on behalf of the company while carrying out assigned duties.

23.question: 4. What types of expenses are reimbursable?
23.answer: Employees may claim reimbursement for the following categories:

24.question: 5. What expenses are not reimbursable?
24.answer:
The following expenses are not eligible for reimbursement: • Personal expenses
• Alcohol, tobacco, or non-business entertainment
• Traffic fines or penalties
• Expenses without valid bills or receipts
• Expenses incurred without prior approval where required

25.question: 6. What are the general reimbursement guidelines?
25.answer:
• All expenses must be incurred solely for official business
• Original bills or digital invoices are mandatory
• Expenses must comply with the defined limits
• Claims must be accurate and truthful
• Any misuse may result in disciplinary action

26.question: 7. Is prior approval required for reimbursement?
26.answer:
• Prior approval is mandatory for:
– Outstation travel
– Flight bookings
– Accommodation
– Training, courses, or certifications
• Local conveyance and mobile reimbursements do not require prior approval if within limits

27.question: 8. What is the reimbursement claim submission timeline?
27.answer:
• Reimbursement claims must be submitted within 30 days from the date of expense
• Claims submitted after 30 days may be rejected unless justified and approved by HR

28.question: 9. How should employees submit reimbursement claims?
28.answer:
• Claims must be submitted through the HRMS or official reimbursement form
• Each claim must include:
– Expense category
– Date of expense
– Amount
– Purpose of expense
– Valid supporting bills or receipts

29.question: 10. What is the approval process for reimbursement?
29.answer:
• Reporting Manager reviews and approves the claim
• Approved claims are forwarded to HR and Finance
• Finance processes the reimbursement after verification

30.question: 11. How long does reimbursement processing take?
30.answer:
• Approved reimbursements are processed within 7–10 working days
• Reimbursement amount is credited along with salary or via bank transfer

31.question: 12. What happens if a claim is rejected?
31.answer:
• Employees will be notified with the reason for rejection
• Claims may be resubmitted after correction if applicable
• HR’s decision will be final in case of disputes

32.question: 13. Is mobile and internet reimbursement mandatory every month?
32.answer:
No.
• Employees may claim mobile/internet reimbursement only for months where official usage occurs
• Maximum reimbursement allowed is ₹1,000 per month

33.question: 14. Can multiple reimbursements be claimed in a single month?
33.answer:
Yes.
• Multiple claims are allowed provided they fall under approved categories and limits
• Total monthly reimbursement must comply with defined caps

34.question: 15. What is the policy for travel reimbursement?
34.answer:
• Economy class travel is reimbursable
• Company-preferred vendors must be used when available
• Travel plans must be optimized for cost and efficiency

35.question: 16. What happens in case of false or inflated claims?
35.answer:
• Submission of false claims is considered misconduct
• Disciplinary action may include:
– Recovery of amount
– Written warning
– Suspension or termination in severe cases

36.question: 17. Are taxes applicable on reimbursements?
36.answer:
• Reimbursements supported by valid bills are generally non-taxable
• Any taxable component will be handled as per applicable income tax laws

37.question: 18. Can management revise reimbursement limits?
37.answer:
Yes.
Management reserves the right to revise reimbursement categories, limits, or procedures based on business needs or statutory requirements, with approval from the Head of HR and Finance.

38.question: 19. Who should employees contact for reimbursement-related queries?
38.answer:
Employees may contact:
• Reporting Manager for approval-related queries
• HR or Finance team for processing and payment-related queries

39.question: 20. Are exceptions allowed under this policy?
39.answer: Exceptions may be granted only in genuine cases with written approval from the Head of HR and Finance.
